item.title: Brownie Cookbook

item.title: Cardio 101
item.description: Introduction Cardio is simply a way for you to work out your cardiovascular system. It’s not super complex and we simply need to make sure we’re doing a healthy amount of high intensitiy and low intensity work.

item.title: Dieting 101
item.description: The Rough Overview Your body composotionm will be 100% of the result of your net energy balance. if your input is greater than your output you will gain weight.

item.title: Fitness
item.description: Fitness is a broad topic so i’ve chosen to categorise what I’ve learnt in these broad topics Dieting 101 Cardio 101 Hormonal Health

item.title: Hormonal Health
item.description: Testosterone Improvement Modern diets are overly processed and this results in an enviroment which is not conducive for testosterone levels

item.title: Reading Highlights
item.description: A list of the 56 Articles I’ve read so far Some Stats Period Amount Read April 2022 56 Articles Life is Short Why I got a PhD at age 61 When your manager isn’t supporting you, build a Voltron Notes on Work Michelle Bu - Payments Products Tech Lead at Stripe From The Desk Of A Trader #2 Code rewrites and joint cognitive systems A Tale of Yak Shaving- Accidentally Making a Language, for an Engine, for a Game The True Sources of DeFi Yield Why Maple Finance’s Milkshakes Will Bring All Building data-centric apps with a reactive relational database Don’t Write Just in Plain Text How Women-and Their Hair-Transformed South Korea The Huge Endeavor to Produce a Tiny Microchip 3-2-1- Handling challenges, living authentically, and giving value Farewell, Big Data How Philosophers Think Two vexing problems in functional programming A beginner’s guide to social tokens Are we running out of resources- The Classpath is a Lie Michael Plant - University of Oxford A beginner’s guide to DeFi Is Web3 a Solution Seeking a Problem- The Career Success Guide There’s never been such a severe shortage of homes in the U.

item.title: Smart Contracts
item.description: Smart contracts are computer programs that live on the blockchain These programs are immutable and distributed. Therefore they are resistant to tampering and can be used trustlessly.

item.title: Solidity
item.description: Initialising A Program We initialise a program by defining the compiler version and then initialising contracts 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 // Define the compiler version you would be using pragma solidity ^0.

item.title: Solidity Gas Optimization
item.description: Introduction We want to minimise the cost of gas to our users because that’ll result in a large amount of unneccessary expenses for them otherwise.

item.title: Technical Things
item.description: I’m currenltly pre-occupied with learning about Typescript Trading Bots Testing With Cypress Web3

item.title: Testing With Cypress
item.description: Introduction Cypress allows you to automate the testing of your code. The goal of using a tool like Cypress is to be able to refactor with confidence.

item.title: Trading Bots
item.description: Introduction Notes from my lil foray into automated money making~ A smart contract is a program that runs on the Ethereum blockchain.

item.title: Typescipt
item.description: Overview Typescript is an open source, typed syntactic superset of Javascript. It compiles to readable JS Using typescript, we can write better programs which are easier to edit and refactor down the line.

item.title: Web3
item.description: These contain the notes that I made for the Web3 Dao Course Blockchain A blockchain is a shared, distributed, and permanent database shared among multiple nodes on a computer network.
